Reviews.Title: android of the future
Reviews.Author: Albert Santiago
Reviews.Content: PHONE is very futuristic in presence. It will capture everyone's attention. Looks like a heart monitor on your wrist. Lol. Literally. WiFi capable works well. Bluetooth capabilities. Speaker on voice calls sounds low but with headset sounds well. MP3 / MP4 sounds loud & clear. Apps that dont exceed o.s 2.2 work well. Pandora,YouTube,Google maps, voice search , voice commands. Games work but screen is smaller than most phones plus on your wrist makes it uncomfortable. Video chats don't work even though there's a camera/camcorder built-in & even if , the eye is placed,sideways instead of in the top center of the screen as it should have. Battery life is about 8-10 hours on sleep mode and 4-6 hours while using but depends on what your using it for as internet takes most power and text and calls take the least. I almost forgot, the charger is short and its male to female usb. It charges within 30 minutes. 8 gb micro sd with adapter. If you have chubby fingers, I recommend a thin stylus. I'm still testing the capabilities, so far shows promise. I highly recommend it for techies, however , for other consumers id say wait till they perfect the smart watch. If your a consumer that only needs it to check your fb, Twitter and other social networks and talk, text and listen to music ? Then buy this. Buy it and you wont regret it. And yes , you get email too. ;)

Reviews.Title: SVP Z1 Android Smart Watch
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I have 5 other Phone Watches and this one is by far the best of them in most aspects.1. Phone quality: I tried to use the included bluetooth headset and the sound quality on the other end of the conversation is poor. The speaker phone is real soft and makes a static/hissing sound when you hit the speakerphone button on the phone. So, if you are in a loud area you might be out of luck unless you find a headset with better sound quality.2. Camera:  I have 5 other watch phones and this watch has a killer Video/Camera compared to the others on the market.  I am a big video recording person and love that this thing takes great Videos and pictures.  So, they don't compare to my Galaxy S III's pictures or videos. The video is smooth and I assume it shoots at 30FPS.3. WIFI:  The WIFI doesn't always seem to work and I am not sure why.  I can get the WIFI to work at work but not at home... your experience may vary.4. SIM Card: This SVP Z1 adnroid watch uses a standard SIM card and only has one SIM card slot.  I use T-Mobile and I ended up going to a monthly plan from the Pay as you go plan due to the fact that I wanted to use the Internet.  So, if you don't care about using the Internet or using data you can go with "Pay as you Go" option.5. Functions: The phone doesn't come with the Google Play Store... it comes with APTOIDE.  So far I have been able to find most of the stuff I have on my Galaxy SIII. The phone has a calculator, Alarm, sound recorder, Video recorder and camer, Internet and a few other things.6. I did notice that you can do APP to SD to save memory on the phones memeory. Yes, the phone does come with an 8Gig memory card.7. LCD screen: The LDC screen is not the highest quality and it's not the lowest quality. That being said, I have noticed some yellowish tint ( found out it's the viewing angle) in the white areas of the background pictures and when taking some video's.  The picture will fade depending on what angle you look at it and it looks "washed out". The Colors are not "POPPING" like I was hoping they would but what can you expect from a $234 Phone watch. There isn't a pen to use on the screen and typing on the "Micro QWERY keyboard" is a little fustrating at times.Conclusion:  I would recommend this to anyone who like the coolness factor and would like something that they could use as to take video or picture without wipping out their bulky camera or phone, if they don't want to take their phone with them or if it dies they have a backup.Update 3/4/13I found my jabra bluetooth headset and it seems to work just fine with call quality.  So, I guess I am totaly satisfied with this watch. So, as things come up I will post updates.

Reviews.Title: Nice regarding price
Reviews.Author: Markus
Reviews.Content: like it very muchpros:- very high standby- lots of RAM (2 GB (4x the RAM of iPhone 4S))- lots of storage with included 8 GB micro SD card- VERY cool USB connector in wristband included !!!- screen resolution same as HTC Wildfire mobile phone (!!!)- cam shots quite nice pics regarding size of gear- quite fast reaction on screen regarding very limited CPU capacitycons:- very poor WiFi range- no Google Play market. Has just it's own store which has not all of Google Play apps. (But most important ones are there)- some apps are not working because of the limited resolution of screen- haven't found any user manual- haven't found any further information on webpage of seller or producer regarding further info and update

Reviews.Title: (Almost) an iPhone killer
Reviews.Author: Peter Leighton
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I need to have my phone with me at all times & I leave it home sometimes. With this watch, it's much harder to misplace. But not only that. It functions as you would expect a smartphone to function. All of that on your wrist! This is a prelude to the next generation of even smaller smartphones.But, it's not quite there yet. Some improvements need to be made. A better WiFi connection would really help. More battery life.  I could not get the internal GPS to work at all. (I really wanted to use Google Maps.) 3G or 4G system would be great along with updated Android OS. 2.2 IS NOT "2.75G" as they claim.  Improve those things & it will get that 5th star.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: trev
Reviews.Content: Ive had the watchpone for about 6 months and i have to say i am very pleased with it.Appstore will not work but it comes with Aptoid another market store and ive found all i need on this.Wifi does work but you need to be very close to the router, i have found everything must be downloaded using wifi otherwise you get a lot of errors.But, providing you use wifi no problems at all with downloading and installing,dont use ordinary internet conection.I am using the pre installed firmware that comes with the unlt.Ive installed lots of apps all run fine.Unit i think is very robust, the charger conection at end of strap is brill and very well made.Call quality is good

Reviews.Title: I don't normally rate products but this product is nothing like I expected
Reviews.Author: kevinn
Reviews.Content: The resolution is less than sufficientThe wifi doesn't connect to most common security encryptions on most home routersThe touchscreen is less than adequateThe internal memory is very smallI used it once and put it away

Reviews.Title: happy costumer
Reviews.Author: David Ellison
Reviews.Content: It works great wifi connects quikly touch screen responds very well i highly recommend it i took a star because of the charger is kind of flemsy very delicate for such a steardy watch i been working in mine every since i had it from 8 to 5 moving furniture the batterie also lasts most oc the day with out recharging and i listen to music and talk on the phone plus surf the net so i say it worth the money

Reviews.Title: love this phone watch wifi  get smart
Reviews.Author: ron franks
Reviews.Content: love it smile for the camera  don't text and drive  don't drink and drive  happy happy  joy joy  surfs up

Reviews.Title: garbage no good nothing work properly for two days which is how long it lost fo
Reviews.Author: miguel
Reviews.Content: It is garbage stop working within two days could not see anything on screen cannot hear anything whenever it was operating to say completely garbage

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: Ricardo rodriguez
Reviews.Content: it was not as described? just a pease of junk? it broke down a lot,and you have to reset a lot.

Reviews.Title: Trouble with wifi
Reviews.Author: Jerry armstrong
Reviews.Content: It works great, but I can't get the wifi to engage; it comes in and out. The monthly fees are a little high.

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: VML
Reviews.Content: Boo!Slim sharp sent me a unit with a dead pixel. I tried for refund . The person that emailed asked for a pic so they could see for themselves...then imply that it was a normal thing and then proceeded to explain electronic displays to me as though I knew nothing. I happen to be an electronics tech with 20 years experience ,I am a pilot too. I have great vision and can spot defects ...now surely 1 dead pixel I could live with but for $200 I would expect better quality control. Instead I have ran into hassles.  I recommend not buying from them as it seems quality control and customer support are lacking...

Reviews.Title: THIS PRODUCT IS FAIR
Reviews.Author: Chukwuedo Jude I.
Reviews.Content: Though this product is nice no doubt it has its cons. The wifi is not functional, no google play store and it occasionally gets stucked when actively making use of it and its battery doesn't last enough

Reviews.Title: looks cool and that's it
Reviews.Author: Costel Breahna
Reviews.Content: every application that I wanted to install had an error "incompatible with this device"...doesn't worth the money!!!I keep it on my wrist just as a bracelet,that's all what is it good for...

Reviews.Title: Android 2.2 Smartphone Watch
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I have only had this Smartphone watch for 2 days. Overall, it would be a fun toy and would probably consider buying the next generation model, but I had to return this one because it came out of the box with a dead pixel on the LCD screen. Slightly frustrating nonetheless.  I didn’t have much time to necessarily give this a fair review, so I’m giving you my initial impressions after my 2 days of having the phone.The backlighting is overpowered and leaves more to be desired. The LCD screen always looks white-washed/faded out and brightness levels do not do much for the LCD screen. WiFi range is good considering a device as small as this, however it is slow and turned off at random intervals. I had set the option for WiFi to connect automatically when in range, but it failed to do this on numerous occasions. Camera is well positioned for taking pictures, but improbable to use for video conferencing. Unfortunately, does not have a true dual core processor as advertised and would assume it has much less than 2 GB of RAM. I would recommend using a solid picture/color as the background as trying to use one of the Live Wallpapers pre-installed on the watch lags and chops up the animation. Does not have the Google Play store, but instead uses Aptoide. Standby battery life is great, but when you are browsing the internet or downloading, the battery life significantly reduces.
